reviewText: Fantastic for any kid who loves trains. This video has been watched for almost a year; tough on me sometimes, but he loves it.
Bought this for my 3 yr old son for Christmas, but am finding that the whole family enjoys watching this one! His twin brothers especially like it as well.  Nice history of the steam locomotive too.
My son loves it except the part on the dog story. If the whole DVD is only about trains will be perfect
My grandson love it! Recommend to anyone that loves trains!
Great book for my grandson who loves trains!
Too much talking, not enough trains for 2.5-year-old.
My kids love this movie. Thank you!
Bought this for grandson that loves trains and he loves this fast service. Will have to do some searching to find more.

I bought this DVD for my 2 1/2 year old son who loves trains. I wanted to get away from the Thomas and Friends to show him the real trains and the model trains. He enjoys watching this movie while playing with all his trains. However from an adult standpoint, its a bit dull. No fancy graphics or special effects. Its fine for the younger kids.

This DVD is soo bad! It looks like it was made by a 12 year old with a home camcorder. MMy son, who loves trains, and watches the shows constantly, will not watch this DVD for more than 10 minutes. Do your self a favor and buy a different DVD.
My three year old is a train fanatic, so I am always looking for something to peak his interest.  He has watched this OVER and OVER and doesn't seem to get sick of it.  Educational too.

My little grandson (age 3) watches this DVD at least once a day.  I was so glad I had trusted the reviews that I read.  He has a great love for train-real/toy and is totally engrossed in this movie when he is watching.  It is educational too.
My son is in love with trains.  He loves this video.  He has probably watched it 35-40 times in the last 2 months.  It was even interesting enough for his big brother the first 10 or so times.
